page.title: 12Blandford Fire Engine Rally
page.content: On the 13th & 14th July 1985 the 10th Annual Engine Rally was in Blandford in Crown Meadows.I went there on the 13th with my family & our French Student.It was 50p for children Â£1.50 for adults.When we got in we went on a train which went up & down the rows of machines.Then we went on a fire engine up & down the rows.It rings sometimes. My brother sat at the front.I sat by the window.Before going home we went on the bouncy castle.There were lots of stalls but we did not go round them.As you went out you got a stamp on your hand so you could come in & go out without paying again. In 1981 the 250th anniversary of the fire of Blandford was commemorated by printing 1000 First Day Covers-an idea of Station Officer Ernie Adams.MBE who also organises the Dorset Fire Engine Rally.
